title: Conic hyperspectral dispersion mapping applied to semiconductor plasmonics
title_cn: 圆锥高光谱色散映射应用于半导体等离子体
abstract: The surface plasmon resonance tracking over metal surfaces is a well-established, commercially available, biochemical quantification tool primarily applied in research. The utilization of such a tool is, however, constrained to highly specialized industries, capable of justifying the human and instrumental resource investments required by the characterization method. We have proposed to expand the field of application of this biosensing approach by redesigning this method through the integration and miniaturization within a semiconductor platform. Uncollimated and broadband emission from a light-emitting semiconductor is employed to couple a continuum of surface plasmon modes over a metal–dielectric architecture interfaced with a GaAs–AlGaAs substrate. A tensor version of rigorous coupled wave theory is employed to optimize the various fabrication specifications and to predict the light scatterings over a wide range of variables. We then present a hyperspectral characterization microscope capable of directly mapping the dispersion relation of scattered light, including diffracted surface plasmons, as an intensity distribution versus photon energy and surface wavevectors. Measurements carried out in a buffered solution demonstrate the accurate description of the uncollimated and broadband surface plasmon states. Finally, we introduce a simplified method of dispersion mapping, in which quasi-conic cross-sections of the light's scattering can be acquired directly, thus monitoring surficial responses in as fast as 1.2 s. This is over 300 times faster than required by implementing full dispersion mapping. While compromising on the volume of collected information, this method, combined with the solid-state integration of the platform, shows great promise for the fast detection of biochemical agents.
abstract_cn: 在金属表面上跟踪表面等离振子共振是一种成熟的，可商购的生化定量工具，主要用于研究中。但是，这种工具的使用仅限于高度专业化的行业，它们能够证明表征方法所需的人力和工具资源投资的合理性。我们建议通过在半导体平台内进行集成和小型化来重新设计该方法，以扩大该生物传感方法的应用范围。来自发光半导体的未准直和宽带发射被用来在与GaAs AlGaAs衬底相接的金属介电结构上耦合连续的表面等离子体激元模。严格耦合波理论的张量形式用于优化各种制造规格，并预测各种变量上的光散射。然后，我们提出了一种高光谱表征显微镜，该显微镜能够直接绘制包括衍射表面等离子体激元在内的散射光的色散关系，作为强度分布与光子能量和表面波矢量的关系。在缓冲溶液中进行的测量证明了未准直和宽带表面等离子体激元状态的准确描述。最后，我们介绍了一种简化的色散映射方法，在该方法中，可以直接获取光散射的准圆锥形横截面，从而以1.2秒的速度监视表面响应。这比实现完全色散映射所需的速度快300倍以上。该方法在不影响收集信息量的同时，结合平台的固态集成，为快速检测生化试剂提供了广阔的前景。

title: Optically monitoring and controlling nanoscale topography during semiconductor etching
title_cn: 在半导体蚀刻过程中光学监控纳米尺度的形貌
abstract: We present epi-diffraction phase microscopy (epi-DPM) as a non-destructive optical method for monitoring semiconductor fabrication processes in real time and with nanometer level sensitivity. The method uses a compact Mach–Zehnder interferometer to recover quantitative amplitude and phase maps of the field reflected by the sample. The low temporal noise of 0.6 nm per pixel at 8.93 frames per second enabled us to collect a three-dimensional movie showing the dynamics of wet etching and thereby accurately quantify non-uniformities in the etch rate both across the sample and over time. By displaying a gray-scale digital image on the sample with a computer projector, we performed photochemical etching to define arrays of microlenses while simultaneously monitoring their etch profiles with epi-DPM.
abstract_cn: 我们提出了外延衍射相显微镜（epi-DPM），它是一种无损光学方法，用于实时监控半导体制造过程并具有纳米级灵敏度。 该方法使用紧凑型马赫曾德尔干涉仪来恢复样品反射场的定量振幅和相位图。 每像素8.93帧/秒的0.6＆＃160 nm的低时间噪声使我们能够收集显示湿法刻蚀动力学的三维电影，从而准确地量化整个样品以及整个样品上刻蚀率的不均匀性 时间。 通过使用计算机投影仪在样品上显示灰度数字图像，我们执行了光化学蚀刻以定义微透镜阵列，同时使用Epi-DPM监视其蚀刻轮廓。
